item.title: Using Image Markers while Grouping Data in Smart Markers
item.description: Using Image Markers while Grouping Data in Smart Markers The following sample creates a workbook and then adds the following smart marker tags in cells D2, E2 and F2 respectively. &=Person.Name(group:normal,skip:1) &=Person.City &=Person.Photo(Picture:FitToCell) Then it fills the data source with data and calls the WorkbookDesigner.Process() method to process smart marker tags. The code uses these images i.e moon.png and moon2.png but you can use any image. \ Attachments: moon.png (image/png) moon2.

item.title: Show leading apostrophe in cells
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Show leading apostrophe in cells 1.1 Sample Code | Show leading apostrophe in cells In Microsoft Excel, the leading apostrophe in the cell’s value is hidden. Aspose.Cells provides the feature to display the apostrophe by default. For this, the API provides Workbook.Settings.QuotePrefixToStyle property. This property indicates whether to set the QuotePrefix property when entering string value starting with a single quote to the cell.
